abstract: The e-mail did not capture the full story behind the $175 million wire transfer, which turned out to contain customer money.
snippet: The e-mail did not capture the full story behind the $175 million wire transfer, which turned out to contain customer money.
lead_paragraph: Jon S. Corzine, the former chief executive of MF Global, was told during the brokerage firm’s final day of business that a crucial transfer of $175 million came from the firm’s own money, not from a customer account, according to an internal e-mail.

headline.main: E-Mail to Corzine Said Transfer Was Not Customer Money

byline.original: By Ben Protess and Azam Ahmed

abstract: Michaels Stores, the arts and crafts retailer owned by the Blackstone Group and Bain Capital, plans to file to go public as soon as next week, in what could be one of the biggest initial public offerings of the year.
snippet: Michaels Stores, the arts and crafts retailer owned by the Blackstone Group and Bain Capital, plans to file to go public as soon as next week, in what could be one of the biggest initial public offerings of the year.
lead_paragraph: Michaels Stores, the arts and crafts retailer owned by the Blackstone Group and Bain Capital, plans to file to go public as soon as next week, according to people briefed on the matter. The initial public offering could be one of the biggest of the year.

headline.main: Michaels Stores Prepares for an I.P.O.

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
